data: Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the powerplan (NOT required for direct admit patients)
q4h, heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure, temperature
q2h, heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure, temperature
q1h, heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure, temperature
q12h, heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure, temperature
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness.  Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
Age: 9-12 months, Texture: Minced and Moist 5
Age: 1-3 years, Texture: soft and Bite-Sized 6
Age: 4-8 years, Texture: Regular and Easy to Chew 7
Age: 9-13 years, Texture: Regular and Easy to Chew 8
Age: 14-18 years, Texture: Regular and Easy to Chew 9
Provider must order starting diet.  RN or RD to place subsequent diet orders.
Review chemotherapy orders for fluid administration before completing these orders. Discontinue all fluid hydration orders prior to chemotherapy
Calculate Pediatric Maintenance Fluids based on 4-2-1 Rule
dextrose 5% - sodium chloride 0.9% (dextrose 5%-sodium chloride 0.9% (D5NS) continuous infusion
Review chemotherapy orders before completing medication orders

Referral to Clinic Not Using CST Cener
Next Available Appointment, Paper Referral, Canuck Place Children's Hospice
RN to Initiate the Hematopoeitc Stem Cell Infusion Day 0 phase of this plan in the morning of infusion
Baseline pre infusion. Monitor blood pressure, heart rate, oxygen saturation, respiratory rate and temperature q15min until infusion complete.
Use Dove soap and apply dermabase cream to entire body qdaily
125 mL/m2/h, IV, order duration: 2 hour, drug form: bag
125 mL/m2/h, IV, order duration: 2 hour, drug form: bag
125 mL/m2/h, IV, order duration: 6 hour, drug form: bag
125 mL/m2/h, IV, order duration: 6 hour, drug form: bag
Review chemotherapy orders before completing medication orders
50 mg/m2, IV, q24h, prophylaxis, drug form:inj
Ensure adequate hydration during concurrent acyclovir therapy
250 mg/m2, IV, q12h, drug form: inj
15 mg/kg, PO, pre-procedure, drug form: oral liq
15 mg/kg, PO, pre-procedure, drug form: tab
1 mg/kg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
Ensure anaphylaxis kit is available at the patient's bedside prior to stem cell infusion
0.01 mg/kg, IM, q5min, PRN anaphylaxis, order duration: 3 doses or times, drug form: inj
1 mg/kg, IV once, PRN itching or rash, drug form: inj
2 mg/kg, IV, once, PRN anaphylaxis, drug form: inj
5 mg, nebulized, q20min, PRN shortness of breath or wheezing, order duration: 3 doses or times, drug form: neb
A physician must be present and in the room during infusion of thawed hematopoietic stem cells preserved in dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO)
Other - Specify in Indication Comments, Source: Peripheral Blood - Thawed, IV, Admin Over: Other, specify in comments
Other - Specify in Indication Comments, Source: Peripheral Blood - Fresh, IV, Admin Over: Other, specify in comments

Other - Specify in Indication Comments, Source: Marrow - Thawed, IV, Admin Over: Other, specify in comments
Other - Specify in Indication Comments, Source: Cord Blood - Thawed, IV, Admin Over: Other, specify in comments
Conditional Order: Nurse to Place lab Order - One time
If/when stem cell infusion complete, then RN to order potassium level q1h post infusion
Conditiional order - Nurse to Place Lab Order - Ongoing
If/when stem cells infusing, then RN to obtain urinalysis until urine clear

Baseline blood pressure, heart rate, oxygen stauration, respiratory rate and temperature pre CAR-T Cell Infusion
During CAR-T Cell Infusion and for a minimum of 2 hours post infusion or until reading returns to pre-infusion baseline

Do not order corticosteroid during CAR-T Cell infusion unless directed by attending physician

A physician must be present and in the room during infusion of thawed CAR-T Cells  preserved in dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO) and must be available for 3 to 4 hours following infusion.
